relation: Great for these types of students

Musical. If you love playing, singing, making, or listening to music. This will be your paradise. You'll find friends the first week and participate in multiple jam sessions a week with several different people.
Cafeteria food is terrible, but I've heard it has gotten better. Prepare yourself for a dry and cigarette free campus.
The degree from Belmont is worth the cost.

The people make the school worth it. The school board doesn't completely care about current students. It is tough to get your voice heard for them to change their policies. The teachers are fun and completely care about their students. They will know if you miss class and are understanding. Music is all over campus, which is amazing.

The classes are challenging, but the teachers and students are extremely helpful. Classes are incredibly small so teachers have the time for one-on-on attention. Some classes are a joke, but most are challenging and you will leave with a lot of information.

Tips for prospective students Take as many Advanced Placement courses and their tests to get those college credits, so that when you get to college, you will have a head start on you degree requirements! Also when you get to college, take your decision to go to college seriously; this is not the place to play around and party! The partying can wait! Get involved too! Being involved in different organizations on campus will yield so many opportunities and networks that will propel your growth as a student and an overall person! Bang for the buck
